title: Spike Milligan - Adolf Hitler - My Part In His Downfall
description:
Adolf Hitler: My Part in His Downfall
Broadcast on BBC Radio

Spike Milligan&#039;s war memoir read by lifelong Milligan fan, Paul Merton.

The first of seven volumes of Milligan&#039;s War memoirs is also a comedy 
classic in its own right. First published in 1971, the book is peppered 
throughout with Milligan&#039;s gags, one-liners and surreal comic invention. 
Indeed, many regard the memoirs as ranking with The Goon Show as his 
greatest work.

The book has also been greatly admired for its portrayal of what life 
was like for the ordinary British soldier during the War, and Milligan&#039;s 
insights are not only hilarious but also poignant and honest.

Paul Merton&#039;s delivery of the gags, characters and Goonish events of the 
story vividly bring to life the experiences of the 22-year-old Milligan 
from call-up through basic training in the early years of the War.

Reader: Paul Merton
Producer: Liz Anstee
Abridged by Mike Haskins
